page.title: 02 Beck Row Village
page.content: We discovered that the name Beck is Scandinavian and so was probably named by the Vikings when they landed on high ground having rowed their boats from The Wash. We managed to follow the dried up course of The Beck or stream as far as {Beck House}, over part of The Close-an area of special interest,as it was part of the grounds of {Aspal Hall}. One resident told us that in I930 there were less than 100 houses and water was drawn from wells. In 1934 the Waterworks was supplying water to most houses. Beck Row started to expand when the R.A.F.opened the airfield and there are now over 1,000 houses in the village. Amenities include a {Village Hall},{Post Office},{Primary School}, 2 {Churches},3 food shops,furniture shop,antiques shop,2 hotels,and 2 public houses.
